# Packages

The Page Builder uses a number of packages to work properly:

  • [Slugify] - Converts a string into a slug.

And of course you can check for more within the projects folder on GitHub.

...

# Composer Overview

####Installing Dependencies

Composer packages are generally found at Packagist

php composer.phar install

####Autoload Dependencies

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

####Updating Dependencies to their Latest Versions

php composer.phar update

####Removing dependencies

php composer remove jenssegers/mongodb --update-with-dependencies

# Global

The global command allows you to run other commands like install, remove, require or update as if you were running them from the COMPOSER_HOME directory.

This is merely a helper to manage a project stored in a central location that can hold CLI tools or Composer plugins that you want to have available everywhere.

# install CLI utilities globally

php composer remove jenssegers/mongodb --update-with-dependencies

Now the php-cs-fixer binary is available globally. Make sure your global vendor binaries directory is in your $PATH environment variable, you can get its location with the following command :

php composer.phar global config bin-dir --absolute

If you wish to update the binary later on you can run a global update:

php composer.phar global update

# install CLI utilities globally

# Packages

# Slugify

# Installation

$ composer require cocur/slugify

# Cheat Scripts

# Find Directory

You will need to require vendor/autoload.php create a file with the script bellow to find the current directory of the target file, as well as your composer file

<?php
$dir = dirname(__FILE__);
echo "<p>Full path to this dir: " . $dir . "</p>";
echo "<p>Full path to a .composer file in this dir: " . $dir . "/.composer" . "</p>";
?>

# Changing Directories

# change working directory

Optionally you can change the current working directory with the php chdir() function

<?php
//outputs current directory of file you are in
echo getcwd() . "\n";

chdir('/var/www/'); // change the directory to '/var/www/'

// Outputs the result of the chdir function '/var/www');

echo getcwd() . "\n";


?>

# change working directory

The chroot() function is used to change the root directory of the current process to the specified directory.

chroot(directory_name)

# Scan directories

Scan a whole directory and generate a list of files and subdirectories inside a path

<?php
print_r(scandir('test'));
?>

$dir    = '/tmp';
$files1 = scandir($dir);
$files2 = scandir($dir, 1);

print_r($files1);
print_r($files2);

# Fopen reminder

http://php.net/manual/en/function.fopen.php http://php.net/manual/en/function.fopen.php

# Usage

Generate a slug:

use Cocur\Slugify\Slugify;

$slugify = new Slugify();
echo $slugify->slugify('Hello World!'); // hello-world

You can also change the separator used by Slugify:

echo $slugify->slugify('Hello World!', '_'); // hello_world

More info can be found at Slugify

# Using Packages

# Adding Auto Load Script

Before any class initiation, just add the vendor/autoload.php file in the PHP scripts.

<?php

require __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';

use Cocur\Slugify\Slugify;

$slugify = new Slugify();

echo $slugify->slugify('Hello World, this is a long sentence and I need to make a slug from it!');
